page.title: 02-Chilton-Population,Housing-
page.content: The main trunk road between Birmingham and Southampton divides Chilton village in two.Sited near the school on one side of the road are 100 prefabricated houses erected after World War Two, housing employees of the Atomic Energy Research Establishment,Harwell.On the other side is the church and nucleus of the village,now comprising 260 houses. The main street through the village has older cottages,no longer thatched, on either side,and leading off are small estates of newer houses.The streets are lit by electric lights. The population of the village is about 1040.40 years ago there were only 48 dwellings.All houses have mains electricity,drainage and water,but not gas.Until 1940,water was drawn from wells or from the village pump,which was installed in 1935 after a drought. <<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<< >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>
